sentence.Network_en: Then came an invitation to Martinique , an island in the French Caribbean. It was chance of a lifetime.
sentence.Network_cn: 然后被邀请到法属加勒比海的马提尼克岛, 这真是千载难逢的机会.

sentence.Network_en: Martinique, Netherlands Antilles located the Windward Islands the most northern.
sentence.Network_cn: 马提尼克岛, 位于安的列斯群岛中的向风群岛的最北部.

sentence.Network_en: France has 4 overseas departments ( French Guiana, Guadeloupe, Martinique and Reunion ).
sentence.Network_cn: 法国还有4个海外省 ( 法属圭亚那 、 瓜德罗普 、 马提尼克和留尼汪 ).

PerfectNetExp.abs: martini 马蒂尼枪, martinique 马蒂尼克, martinik 马丁尼克

means.word_mean: 1. an island in the eastern Caribbean in the Windward Islands; administered as an overseas region of France

auth_sentence.content: One voter in Martinique questioned whether the country could cope politically with more autonomy.
auth_sentence.res_content: One voter in Martinique questioned whether the country could cope politically with more autonomy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One voter in Martinique questioned whether the country could cope politically with more autonomy.

auth_sentence.content: When we were on the beach yesterday, did you happen to notice Martinique?
auth_sentence.res_content: When we were on the beach yesterday, did you happen to notice Martinique?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When we were on the beach yesterday, did you happen to notice Martinique?

auth_sentence.content: French settlers from Martinique establish a colony and found Saint George's, the present capital.
auth_sentence.res_content: French settlers from Martinique establish a colony and found Saint George's, the present capital.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: French settlers from Martinique establish a colony and found Saint George's, the present capital.
